job.title: RSA ARCHER DEVELOPER  on W2
job.description:
RSA Archer Developer

Secaucus, NJ - 100% Remote

5 Months Contract - May Extend

 

The opportunity

As a RSA Archer Developer, you will be part of a dynamic and growing product team responsible for the design, development and implementation of various Archer modules built to support multiple functions within Information Security. The role will work closely with business teams to drive business process and requirements into the Archer platform. This role relies on close collaboration with architects, security consultants, members of the operations and engineering teams and other technology teams.

 

Key responsibilities

Design and configure various components utilizing Archer core and custom modules

Participate in complete software lifecycle – analysis, design, develop, test, and deploy solutions on enterprise Archer platform.

Collaborate with product owners to provide solution designs, process mapping and documenting and developing modules within the RSA Archer platform including layout, workflow, reporting, notifications, questionnaires, access control, packaging, etc.

Design and develop data integration flows with other systems using Archer APIs or other methods

Perform release/deployment tasks ensuring successful packaging and deployment within the stack (Dev, QA, UAT, Prod)

 Provide on-going maintenance, operations, and technical support

Improve or automate existing business processes using native Archer capabilities

Prepare formal documentation including technical specification requirements specifications, system design documents, use cases and user manual

 Contribute to setting and maintaining architectural standards/principals, define development and operational policies and frameworks, to govern all aspects of Archer application development

Contribute to Archer product roadmap to define future state of the product to support business demand based on industry trends and best practices

 

Skills and attributes for success

Strong analytical and design skills, including the ability to understand business requirements and translate them into efficient and effective technical designs that work well within large-scale, well-structured enterprise environments

Strong trouble-shooting skills, with the ability to quickly identify and document the root cause of issues, and effectively communicate possible resolutions

Strong verbal, written and interpersonal communications skills

Ability to work effectively, as well as independently, in a distributed team environment focused on delivering quality services and solutions

Possess solid grasp of Agile or other rapid application development methods

Be flexible to adjust to multiple demands, shifting priorities, ambiguity and rapid change

Demonstrated knowledge of industry trends and standards of the Archer suite of products

Provide suggestions for technical design improvements and demonstrate problem solving

Demonstrated knowledge of the IT & Security Risk, Enterprise & Operational Risk, Third Party Governance and Business Resiliency uses cases of Archer.

 

To qualify for the role you must have

Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Information Technology, or related experience required.

In-depth knowledge of all Archer core solutions, their practical intention, their out of box workflows and on-demand applications in RSA Archer v6.x

 Hands-on Agile experience analyzing business requirements and breaking them down into detailed user stories, including UI, workflow and access requirements

2-4 years’ experience configuring Archer modules both out of box and on demand applications, advanced workflow, access roles and groups

1-3 years demonstrated ability working with data and performing data analysis with a basic understanding of data analysis principles

Experience with Oracle, SQL, Javascript, Json, .Net, Python, C.

Experience with solution design and implementation within IaaS, PaaS and SaaS and hybrid model environments preferred

 

Ideally, you’ll also have

Certification in one or more of the following areas: RSA Archer, Agile, Microsoft, ITIL

Experience with RSA Archer SaaS offerings

 

Experience/Required Skills     

To qualify, candidates must have: - approximately 4-6 years of experience in systems analysis and application program development - experience with state-of-the-art application development support software packages - sound interpersonal, communication, organizational, and project management skills - strong judgment and tact - ability to work effectively with clients, management and staff members - proficiency in at least two programming languages

 

Education

A bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience
